alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 11:58PM EDT until May 17 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WAYNE...EDGECOMBE...SOUTHEASTERN HALIFAX...WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 1157 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Scotland Neck to 7 miles southeast of Wilson to near Smithfield, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Smithfield, Wilson, Scotland Neck, Elm City, Fremont, Micro, Selma and Enfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
